items.headline: U.S. Markets Face Downturn as Nvidia's Strong Earnings Lead to Muted Reaction Amid AI Concerns
items.summary: Wall Street experienced a downturn on Thursday, February 26, 2026, with major indices closing lower. Despite Nvidia's stellar fourth-quarter earnings report, investor sentiment was dampened by high expectations for AI growth and lingering concerns over geopolitical tensions and future AI spending. Early gains were erased as the trading day progressed.

items.headline: Nvidia Leads Tech Sell-Off Despite Blowout Earnings
items.summary: Nvidia ($NVDA) shares fell approximately 5% on Thursday, reaching around $186.62, even after the chipmaker reported fourth-quarter revenue of $68.13 billion, exceeding estimates of $66.21 billion, and forecast strong Q1 revenue. The decline is attributed to exceptionally high market expectations and concerns about hyperscalers potentially curbing AI infrastructure spending.

items.headline: IonQ Surges on Strong Q4 Results and Optimistic FY2026 Outlook
items.summary: Quantum computing company IonQ ($IONQ) saw its shares climb 23% after reporting fourth-quarter results that surpassed Wall Street expectations and issuing robust fiscal year 2026 guidance, projecting revenue between $225 million and $245 million.

items.headline: Salesforce Rises on Better-Than-Expected Profit
items.summary: Salesforce ($CRM) shares rose 2.4% after the company reported a stronger profit for its latest quarter than analysts had anticipated.

items.headline: Celsius Holdings Jumps on Significant Earnings Beat
items.summary: Energy drink company Celsius Holdings ($CELH) surged 15% after reporting a 38.4% positive earnings surprise to 26 cents per share, alongside a 13.1% increase in revenues to $721.63 million.

items.headline: Mixed Sector Performance: Tech and Financials See Swings
items.summary: Among S&P 500 sectors, Information Technology and Financials initially showed strength on Wednesday, rising 1.8% and 1.7% respectively. However, by Thursday, the technology sector, particularly semiconductors, faced significant pressure, while financials continued to show some resilience. Industrials lagged, falling 0.8%.

items.headline: Jobless Claims Tick Up Slightly; Fed Official Hints at Rate Cuts
items.summary: U.S. initial jobless claims increased slightly to 212,000 in the week ending February 21, up from 208,000, though this rise was less than anticipated, indicating a still-tight labor market. Meanwhile, a Federal Reserve official suggested that four rate cuts might be appropriate this year.

items.headline: Earnings Reports Offer Mixed Signals Beyond Nvidia
items.summary: Several companies reported earnings on February 26. United Therapeutics ($UTHR) beat EPS estimates but missed on revenue. Photronics ($PLAB) exceeded both EPS and revenue expectations, while Owens Corning ($OC) missed on both. Viatris Inc. ($VTRS) reported robust Q4 2025 revenues and provided 2026 financial guidance.

items.headline: Geopolitical Tensions and AI Spending Shape Macro Trends
items.summary: Indirect talks between the United States and Iran regarding Iran's nuclear program continued to influence oil prices and contribute to overall market caution. The robust demand for AI infrastructure, as highlighted by Nvidia's results, remains a key driver, although concerns about potential scaling back of spending by hyperscalers introduce a degree of uncertainty.
